description:
'''René Lorente''' (born 27 November 1948 in [[Havana|Havana, Cuba]]) is a Cuban-American musician and composer, recognized for having been a member of the [[Orquesta Aragón]], for his solo career and for his collaboration with musicians such as Senén Suárez, [[Enrique Jorrín]], Meme Solís, [[Cachao|Cachao López]], [[Chucho Valdés]] and [[Albita Rodríguez]], among others.

During his career he has performed in genres like [[son cubano]], [[Cha-cha-chá (music)|chachachá]], [[danzón]], [[guaracha]] and [[Instrumental|instrumental music]], and has excelled in the execution of instruments such as the five key wooden flute, the tercerola in Eb and the Böehm flute.
